qas.question: What is the most well-known summary of Calvin's teachings?
What area does the five points of Calvinism focus on?
What is a brief description of Calvinism?

answers.text: the sovereignty or rule of God in all things

qas.question: What Calvinism doctrines are examples of the concept of the sovereignty of God?
Who was an early leader in the Reformed churches?

context: Today, this term also refers to the doctrines and practices of the Reformed churches of which <a4_0>Calvin<a4_0/> was an early leader. Less commonly, it can refer to the individual teaching of Calvin himself. The particulars of Calvinist theology may be stated in a number of ways. Perhaps the best known summary is contained in <a0_0>the five points of Calvinism<a0_0/>, though these points identify <a1_0>the Calvinist view on soteriology<a1_0/> rather than summarizing the system as a whole. Broadly speaking, Calvinism stresses <a2_0>the sovereignty or rule of God in all things<a2_0/> — in salvation but also in all of life. This concept is seen clearly in the doctrines of <a3_0>predestination and total depravity<a3_0/>.
